description: Winter fishing is slow but whitefish can be caught nymphing deep pools. Check regulations as some waters close.
waterConditions: Cold, low water. Ice possible in mornings.

description: Late winter can provide decent fishing on warmer days. Focus on midday hours when fish are most active.
Spring begins to show. Fish become more active. Good nymphing opportunities before the main hatches begin.
waterConditions: Warming, may have higher flows from rain/snow melt.

description: Excellent fishing as waters stabilize and hatches begin. Dry fly fishing improves. Bull trout season opens in some waters.
Prime season begins! Salmonfly hatch on the Deschutes. Excellent dry fly fishing. Reservoirs producing kokanee.
waterConditions: Good flows, may be some snow melt runoff.

description: Peak trout fishing month! All techniques producing. Bass fishing heats up. High mountain lakes become accessible.
waterConditions: Stable flows, clear water. Ideal conditions.

description: Excellent fishing continues. Focus on morning and evening for best action. Terrestrial insect fishing begins.
waterConditions: Warm, lower flows. Fish seek cooler, deeper water.

description: Summer steelhead begin entering the Lower Deschutes. Truscott fishing focuses on early/late. Bass fishing peaks.
waterConditions: Warm, low clear water. Fish early or late.

description: Cooling temperatures improve fishing. Steelhead fishing picks up. Browns become more aggressive as spawning approaches.
Excellent fall fishing. Steelhead runs peak. Brown trout spawning colors show. Fall Chinook enter the river.
waterConditions: Cool, stable. Some fall rains may raise flows.

description: Steelhead fishing continues to be good. Trout fishing slows but can still be productive. Fall Chinook run peaks.
waterConditions: Cool, may have higher flows from rain.

description: Winter fishing begins. Steelhead still available. Check regulations as some waters close for the season.
waterConditions: Cold, low flows. Some waters may ice over.
